Recruiter and HR Growth Operations Specialist

Recruitment: Full life-cycle recruitment for all positions; Accounting and Finance, Business Development/Sales/Account Management, Engineering, HR, IT/Field Support, Marketing, Operations, and Supply Chain from entry level to Executive. Establish recruiting needs by studying organizational plans and objectives; meeting with hiring managers to discuss job needs and complete job intake. Create and edit job descriptions to reflect the requirements and qualifications, to align with the hiring manager needs. Builds applicant sources by researching and contacting passive candidates; provide organizational information, opportunities, and benefits; then creating and maintaining rapport. Determine applicant qualifications by interviewing applicants with consistency; analyzing responses; verifying references; comparing qualifications to job requirements. Arrange management interviews by coordinating schedules; arrange travel, lodging, and meals; escorting applicant to interviews. After interviews are completed; keep in contact with candidates by extending and negotiating offers, as well as letting candidates know they won’t be moving forward and why. Communicate with hiring managers to stay on track and up to date on hiring processGrowth Operations (Internal Special Projects): Create and establish Recruiting Processes for the company using ISO Certification Process

 Full life-cycle recruitment for all Corporate Headquartered departments; Accounting, Analytics, Business Development, Construction, Finance, Finance Operations, Legal, Marketing- Creative and Quantitative, Operations, People Operations, Purchasing, Real Estate, Title and Registration, and Wholesale Operations. Establish recruiting needs by studying organizational plans and objectives; meeting with hiring managers to discuss job needs and complete job intake. Create and edit job descriptions to reflect the requirements and qualifications, to align with the hiring manager needs. Builds applicant sources by researching and contacting passive candidates; provide organizational information, opportunities, and benefits; then creating and maintaining rapport. Determine applicant qualifications by interviewing applicants with consistency; analyzing responses; verifying references; comparing qualifications to job requirements. Arrange management interviews by coordinating schedules; arrange travel, lodging, and meals; escorting applicant to interviews. After interviews are completed; keep in contact with candidates by extending and negotiating offers, as well as letting candidates know they won’t be moving forward and why. Communicate with hiring managers to stay on track and up to date on hiring process.ACCOMPLISHMENTS:o Hired 50 employees in 5 months on 20 different teams/departments.o Received the Company Culture “Be Brave” award, which was voted on by the team members.o Special Project- created an entire organization chart of management for the company in Lucid Charts.o Special Project- established the People Operations landing page on our internal wiki site, Confluence/JIRA, and uploaded documentation to be used by the department for internal and external communication.o Special Project- established a Google Team Drive for the People Operations department, and uploaded all updated and approved communication pieces used by everyone on the team.

•	Cold-call prospects that are generated by external sources of lead.•	Identify decision makers within targeted leads to begin sales process.•	Penetrate all targeted accounts and radiate sales from within client base.•	Collaborate with other representatives to determine necessary strategic sales approaches.•	Create and deliver qualified opportunities to other representatives within the district, when applicable.•	Maintain and grow the company’s database of prospects.•	Ensure follow-up with calls-to-action, appointments, complete profile information, sources, and so on.•	Set up and deliver sales presentations, product/device demonstrations, and other sales actions using promotional and educational materials developed by marketing and brand management.•	Territory analysis, on a daily and quarterly basis to determine focus and identify business growth opportunity, using results data from previous quarters, as well as other dynamics in the healthcare and pharmaceutical industry.•	Analyze current business and create new opportunity to grow market share within existing accounts, as well as identifying and penetrating new accounts.ACCOMPLISHMENTS:o	Promoted to Diabetes Care Specialist after 8 months with company, and relocated to Denver from Phoenix. o	Promoted to Obesity Care Specialist to launch brand new weight loss drug after 8 months in Denver territory on Diabetes team.o	After 5 months of new drug launch, #1 in Colorado, #3 in the Rocky Mountain Region for sales numbers.o	Picked to work company booth for American Diabetes Association Expo 2015 , Diabetes in the Community Booth at Colorado Rapids game, and ADA Diabetes Step out and Walk booth 2014.o	Active member and district lead for WINN, Women In Novo Nordisk.o	Rocky Mountain Region lead for Saxenda/Obesity Sales weekly conference calls.o	Organized and hosted speaker program for all of Denver North territory for Saxenda, the new weight loss medication.

Promoted and launched new sales team.o	2013 Goal Attainment- 93% to goal.o	Attended the PENS (Pediatric Endocrinology Nursing Society) Conference and represented McKesson and EMD Serono face to face to nurses and doctors from all over Northern America in May 2013.CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE, December 2010 – March 2012  •	Interface with customers, company sales and/or service representatives to handle a variety of pre-sales or post-sales service functions. •	Determines the status of equipment returns, repairs, replacements, sales orders, delivery schedules, etc. •	Maintains records of returns, schedule changes, product enhancements or changes, product pricing and resolves return credit problems.•	Work directly with Case Managers, MCOs, and PBMs on patient assistance and reimbursement. •	Learn the reimbursement aspect of pharmaceuticals, as well as become proficient in the prior authorization process from start to finish.

recommendations: April 1, 2017, Diana worked with Ashley in different groups

Ashley is by all definition, a go-getter and doesn't stop until the work is done. As someone who was new to recruiting (coming from a pure sales background), she picked up all the intricacies of talent acquisition extremely quickly and I was very impressed with her ability to not only learn a new skill, but to take it, run with it, and elevate it to a new level. She is not afraid of trying of new things and she has the natural ability to quickly build meaningful, and memorable relationships with candidates and hiring managers alike.
